data.description: Comcast Spectacor is a leading sports and entertainment company with a diverse portfolio including the National Hockey League’s Philadelphia Flyers, the National Lacrosse League’s Philadelphia Wings, the award-winning Xfinity Mobile Arena, and the worldclass esports franchise, T1 Entertainment & Sports. Headquartered in Philadelphia, Comcast Spectacor has more than 50 years of experience, with a proven track record of cultivating championship teams, managing worldclass venues, and promoting vibrant communities. Comcast Spectacor is part of Comcast Corporation, a global media and technology company that operates Comcast Cable, NBCUniversal, and Sky.Job SummaryJoin us at the intersection of tech and culture. Our team runs like a startup inside the larger ComcastNBCU managing an internal data platform used by decision makers at every level. In this internship you’ll move quickly and your work will be highly visible. Lock down data quality, then dive into social, search, and fandom signals to spot the next big thing.Job DescriptionWhat you’ll do● Guard the data: Run daily quality checks to keep datasets accurate, current, and reliable.● Chase the signal: Track title-level trends across multiple platforms covering search, social and fandoms including YouTube, TikTok, Reddit, Fandom, Wattpad, and more.● Surface what matters: Ensure data completeness across categories and titles.● Close the loop: Partner with engineers to feed your findings back into the platform.● Stay ahead: Keep a pulse on emerging media patterns to inform business decisions.What you’ll bring● Tech-curious mindset and interests in data analysis at the audience/user level (no pro experience required).● Culture fluency in gaming/anime/TV/film or adjacent fandoms.● Platform familiarity (YouTube, TikTok, Reddit, Twitch, Fandom, Wattpad) is a plus.● Analytical chops and resourcefulness; experience with social analytics is helpful● Detail obsession and the ability to work independently in a fast-moving team.● Education: Enrolled in Data Science, Media Studies, or related field (preferred, not required).Why this role● Hands-on impact: Your work powers decisions not just slide decks.● Blend tech + culture: Apply analytical skills to what people actually watch, play, and love.● Learn by doing: You’ll be exposed to and working with different business units across the organization.Details:● Location: Los Angeles area (required to be at Universal City office at least 1 day per week)● Duration: January – April (16 weeks)● Hours: required: 10-15 hours / week● PaidInterested candidates should submit a resume.SkillsAccountability, Communication, Professional Etiquette, Relationship Building, Resilience, TeamworkCompensationBase Pay: $17.81Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work.    Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus.  Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits to eligible employees.  We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most.  That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details. The application window is 30 days from the date job is posted, unless the number of applicants requires it to close sooner or later.EducationCertifications (if applicable)Relevant Work Experience0-2 YearsComcast is an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Comcast will consider for employment applicants with arrest or conviction records in accordance with the requirements of applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Please note that federal state, or local laws and regulations may restrict or prohibit Comcast from hiring individuals convicted of certain crimes. Additionally, an applicant’s criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship on the job duties of this position, which may result in the withdrawal of a conditional offer of employment.
